children.text: Building Apps isn't just about starting to write some codes. Most of the Programmers will tell you how painful It is when you get stuck in a bug for hours. This topic is not about getting 0 bugs in your entire Code, because that's not the case in Software Engineering, but this is about showing an approach that can help somebody to reduce the number of hours spent in a bug created by the lack of getting the plan done before execution.
In this article mainly focused on Web/Mobile Development, we'll discover:
The Difference between Designing and Coding, technically.
What tools to use/learn to work efficiently.
How is the Workflow made.
What's next after designing and Coding?
Difference between Design and Code

Both may or may not be done by the same people, but Design is more about thinking about Interaction between Components and picking the right components, while coding is about actually writing the code. Every code that you write needs a design. The amount of time you will spend creating the software design depends on the complexity of the system and your familiarity with the system.

Design is what helps us to know how the User Interaction is going to be built. Here, we discover/create the Beauty of the App, how it's going to look like, and behave according to different inputs from the user.
ðŸ“ŒIn Design, we have User Interfaces and User Experience

A user interface is the point of human-computer interaction and communication on a device, Webpage, or App. This can include display screens, keyboards, a mouse, and the appearance of a desktop. User interfaces enable users to effectively control the computer or device they are interacting with. ðŸ‘‰
You can read more here
The user experience (UX) is how a user interacts with and experiences a product, system, or service. It includes a person's perceptions of utility, ease of use, and efficiency.
ðŸ’¡ Coding

Coding, sometimes called computer programming, is telling a computer what actions to take, and writing code is like creating a set of instructions. By learning to write code, you can tell computers what to do or how to behave in a much faster way. Here, we have two main parts: ðŸ‘‰ The Algorithm: Simply, how the logic of the App is going to be built, based on the Design we have. ðŸ‘‰ The Implementation: Where we write those instructions using a Computer Programming Language.
In our case, the implementation part is going to be using HTML for Content Structure, CSS for styling, and JavaScript for Dynamic behavior.

How is the Workflow made
Simple Steps ðŸ‘‡

Debugging Catching bugs and Corrections. When I get stuck, I use Google, StackOverflow, and Github mainly.
Improving/Adding Features, Of Course, this will also create bugs. So, Debug it!

Pushing Code to Github using Git Git is very Useful for Software Engineers. It helps you to control all the versions of your code/improvements. Every major change made in your code needs to be committed and then pushed to your Remote Github Repository.
